author: Pretty Good Apps

changelog.release_notes:
Added support for usernames and passwords with special characters (e.g. the % sign).
Make sure to update the app and open and save your Opus settings afterwards.

New mode for skip and stop buttons.

Long pressing Select now always advances to next mode/screen. Double tap Select in menu navigation mode make Kodi navigate "back".
Only show host selector if multiple hosts available. Otherwise long pressing Select goes straight to Menu Navigation mode.

Major update!

You can now navigate Kodi's on-screen menus from your wrist. Just long press select and choose "Menu navigation".
Gave some design love to Basalt (monochrome) platform. Looking for feedback here as I rely on emulator rendering for this platform.

Different refresh intervals for different playing media types. More battery friendly and hopefully not noticeably less performant.
Remember you can always refresh the display by giving your watch a good shake.

Also vastly improved the unhappy path experience for users with network problems.
Show volume level as a number inside the volume bar.

New volume bar display.
When changing volume, a visual indication of your volume will now be shown for 2 seconds.
Have action bar display correct icons in short press mode and temporarily change to secondary icons when long pressed.

Finally fix that startup bug. We need better QA!
http://www.reactiongifs.com/r/kbh.gif
Support for basic auth with Kodi hosts.

Multiple host option added!
Due to popular demand (1 vote is all we need), we added a host selector to Opus. Long press the Select button when on the main screen to open the host selector.

You can now add multiple Kodi hosts to Opus via the settings app on your phone and switch between them with the host selector on your wrist. All you fancy people with multiple devices, multiple rooms or multiple houses can now rejoice!
Fixed bug with initialisation caused by wrong DEMO MODE switch.

Usability update:
 - Opus will now monitor the connection to Kodi and give the user feedback about connection problems. Please get in touch with me if you can not get Opus to connect to your Kodi installation
 - Shake your watch to update the screen. A battery-friendly alternative to regularly updating in the background.

Major update!
 - Proper start screen when Opus is not configured yet
 - Informational screen when nothing is playing
 - Start to play from stopped state
 - Show proper movie/TV show info when video is playing

description:
A free, beautiful remote for Kodi. Take control of your media center from your wrist.

Adjust your Kodi's volume by short pressing up and down buttons, skip to previous and next tracks or playlist items by long pressing them.
Switch to skipping and menu navigation by long pressing select and navigate Kodi's on screen menus up, down, left (long press up), right (long press down), select and back (double press select).
 
Shake your watch to update the screen. A battery-friendly alternative to regularly polling Kodi in the background.

In the host selector you can choose your active Kodi host from a list of IPs that is definable in the Settings phone app. Opus supports multiple hosts with password protection.

Opus will always be free. If you like this app, please give it a heart in the app store so that others can find it. If you love this app, donations are great for motivation.

Kodi used to be called XBMC.
